condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: All communities eradicate open defecation and the use of improved sanitation facilities in combination with appropriate hygiene practices is generalized.

description.narrative: In 2019 UNICEF reinforced its strategic position in the sanitation sector and supported Government to develop Madagascar's ODF Road Map and National ODF protocol. UNICEF sanitation interventions in 2019 have resulted in more than 668,000 new people abandoning open defecation and 650,000 additional persons gaining access to basic sanitation. A clear improvement of results was observed compared to 2018, through reviewing some of the implementation strategies such as the payment by results approach and Sani-marketing. Sustainability Check, Data generation and availability (including MICS) helped analyse and reshape our approach and partnership strategies. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019
